review_preview: On the basis of the Trip Advisor ratings, we went and did the 7-course menu.  It was really excellent.  The woman who greeted us was wonderful - she took the time to explain everything to us (and sometimes it wasnt so easy - "anemone", for...
review_full: On the basis of the Trip Advisor ratings, we went and did the 7-course menu. It was really excellent. The woman who greeted us was wonderful - she took the time to explain everything to us (and sometimes it wasnt so easy - "anemone", for instance! And there were other things she didnt know how to translate from Spanish, but her laughter and her charm made up for it!), the servers were all smiles. They were very accomodating - since i dont eat meat or shellfish, they offered me some substitutions that were really tasty (the butterfish was amazing, and the potatoes were great). Another winner was the pumpkin soup. Not everyone I was with loved everything - the pork course was a little chewy, for instance, and the ratatouille was salty, but the food, the presentation and the service was all very special. It's a LOT of food! We had a misunderstanding about whether dessert was included, but our bill got fixed with a big smile and we left very stuffed and very happy. It's a very nice evening out.

title_review: Unusual but very good and fun food
review_preview: This restaurant is unusual and worth trying. Firstly logistics. The tables are not too near to each other so not too much listening to your neighbour's issues.  There is music (that I think is a downside) but not too noisy - a touch modern funky...
review_full: This restaurant is unusual and worth trying.  Firstly logistics. The tables are not too near to each other so not too much listening to your neighbour's issues. There is music (that I think is a downside) but not too noisy - a touch modern funky stuff? There are two branches and we used the one on a street south of the Plaza Mayor. It was open on New Year's Day - unlike many restaurants.  The food was unusual and fun. Look on their online menu and you will see that the chef is experimenting with unusual mushrooms and seafood. One of our party had excellent tartar and another sea anemone. We all liked it and thought it was nicely done. Chocolate dessert was stupendous.  We turned up at 9:30 and could hardly believe that we were not the first to eat - the place was already busy! We left after midnight and were the last to leave. Price was circa 180 euros all in for four with two bottles of pleasant Spanish wines.

title_review: From the origin to the taste
review_preview: Taberna Origen has a great variety of dishes. The menu has been designed for sharing, more than the typical option of a starter and a second dish by person. It¬¥s hard to define which are the starters and which ones are the main dishes, all...
review_full: Taberna Origen has a great variety of dishes. The menu has been designed for sharing, more than the typical option of a starter and a second dish by person. It¬¥s hard to define which are the starters and which ones are the main dishes, all options seem palatable. Also, each dish can be ordered in different portion¬¥s size, which I consider an excellent idea that allow you to choose according the number of persons you are sharing. The restaurant is small but cozy, with high chairs and tables, which gives an informal look according to the kind of food they serve, but never forgetting the quality and quantity. The waitress was very helpful and nice, her recommendations were delicious and she indicated us the best size of the portion for three persons. The most surprising dishes for us were the poached tomatoes filled with Idiazabal¬¥s cheese and the mini squid burgers, exotic mixture, but tasty. Also, the croquettes made with carabineros were soft inside and crunchy outside. Regarding the desserts they were correct, but we hoped more from them, due to quality and exotic of the other dishes. Without hesitating I would try to visit again Taberna Origen searching for a nice dinner full of small and yummy recipes. Furthermore, the price of the food is very reasonable attending the quality and quantity.

review_preview: Lovely restaurant, modern d√©cor & very welcome air conditioning. The staff were very helpful and recommended an excellent red wine - Martin Erdugo I think. We were not hungry enough for the tasting menu but it looked great. Nice amuse bouche and very good breads...
review_full: Lovely restaurant, modern d√©cor & very welcome air conditioning. The staff were very helpful and recommended an excellent red wine - Martin Erdugo I think. We were not hungry enough for the tasting menu but it looked great. Nice amuse bouche and very good breads & butters served. We shared the foie starter which was great but were not fans of the very sweet guava it came with. However the suckling pig and the sweet & sour iberico pork (served pink) were both delicious. My only complaint is that the service became really slow as the place filled up, I would have loved to try the pineapple cannelloni for dessert but got bored waiting! Over all very good, good value for money, especially considering the quality and the location. Also it opens quite early in the evening which is great for us Brits adjusting to Spanish late eating times.

Should get at least 1 star next year

review_full: We decided to finally try this metro-bistro location. We really enjoy the one by Temple Debod and this one was just as nice. It's larger and offers slightly different choices but everything we tried was of high quality and prices are reasonable for a city center restaurant.  The presentation of their food is excellent. For starters we shared the croquettas - which were definitely unique yet terrific. The humus was ok (a bit boring - it could use a bit of spice and more flavor and more pita crisps). Our main dishes were the steak tartar (very good) and the butter fish (good, but a bit too much ponzu sauce for me). For dessert we had the pineapple canelon which was very yummy and the apple tart was also good (very creative version but, for me, a bit too much liquor flavor and i also prefer my apples more cooked). Service was pretty good. We loved the little celery mojito they served and we like how this place opens early to accommodate those who prefer or need to eat earlier than 9pm. Overall, a very good experience and worthy of a repeat visit.

title_review: Excellent and imaginative menu, great service!
review_preview: My local hosts brought me to this restaurant for a business meal, and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The decor is very nice and the dining room is very spacious, but the best thing is the menu. Simply fabulous!We started with several appetizers, including croquetas,...
review_full: My local hosts brought me to this restaurant for a business meal, and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The decor is very nice and the dining room is very spacious, but the best thing is the menu. Simply fabulous! We started with several appetizers, including croquetas, and anemones with various types of seaweed. The croquetas were to die for, and the anemones were really delicious - I have never tasted anything like that! There are many options for main dishes, including a delicious pork dish (cerdo). My hosts had fish and sea scallops - and everything was just delicious! Don't miss the chocolate dessert: four types of chocolate dishes, simply amazing! The service was great, very prompt, friendly and knowledgeable. The waiters explained every dish to us.  This was definitely one of the best meals I've ever had, and I strongly recommend this restaurant!

review_preview: This place is located less than five minutes from Plaza Mayor, but it's a lot better than anything you can find there. The dishes are very unique. As seafood lovers, my dad and I both got the shrimp on fire as a starter, and it...
review_full: This place is located less than five minutes from Plaza Mayor, but it's a lot better than anything you can find there. The dishes are very unique. As seafood lovers, my dad and I both got the shrimp on fire as a starter, and it did not disappoint. The fire was cool, but we care about food quality, and the dish excelled there as well. The garlic flavor was strong but not overpowering, and there was a good balance of shrimp and mushrooms. It was a good start, but it got even better with the introduction of the elusive butterfish, which we hadn't been able to find for three years. It is, quite simply, one of the most succulent fish in existence, and the addition of citrus-flavored ponzu sauce somehow made it even better. This was simply the best meal we had in Spain, and every dish we had in the country was exceptional. The butterfish was that good. The price was reasonable as well, and a delicious dessert, "Tribute to Chocolate," didn't hurt either. Bottom Line: if you like seafood, this place is worth it for the butterfish alone.

review_full: We couldn‚Äôt find a good place to eat near Puerta De Atocha. Oven Mozzarella/Atocha was the best we could find. It‚Äôs clean, seats groups up to 8-9, and offers tasty Italian food. The kids shared one thin-crust Diavola pizza with pepperoni. My husband ordered two Penne Carbonera, which was good. The eggplant (vegetarian) linguine was also good. We all shared a delicious spinach salad, topped with walnuts, soft cheese and dates, sprinkled with reduced balsamic vinegrette. I ordered the pasta stuffed with squash, which was a little too sweet. With one ‚Äúdouble beer‚Äù and some bottles of bubbly water ‚Äúcon gas,‚Äù the bill came to about 77 Euros. Our service was okay, on two occasions, although possibly the Ecuadorian was best. If you walk toward the McDonalds (highest grossing in Spain) from the train station, you‚Äôll find Oven Mozzarella just a few doors uphill from the KFC. It‚Äôs worth checking out, and reserve online in advance!

A visit to the surrounding area before or after is a must.

review_preview: Was staying overnight in Barajas between flights at the Madrid airport on a business trip. From my Hotel window (Hotel Villa de Barajas) I spotted this small restaurant on very small street behind the Hotel - the customers at the outdoor tables looked so happy...
review_full: Was staying overnight in Barajas between flights at the Madrid airport on a business trip. From my Hotel window (Hotel Villa de Barajas) I spotted this small restaurant on very small street behind the Hotel - the customers at the outdoor tables looked so happy and the scene seemed very local compared the the restaurants on the main street in front of the hotel. So I went alone for dinner (on a Wednesday night). The owner/chef and staff were so gracious to this solo traveler with virtually no Spanish - super patient with me. The scene is casual and friendly and indeed many customers are locals of a range of ages. The interior is small, warm, a little hip and charming. They have a nice selection of beers including craft Spanish beers (wine too. but I didn't pay attention to it) and the food is great. I had mussels, sardine on toast, ensaladilla, Oreja (grilled confit of pig ear - hey, you're in Spain, live a little) and Torrenzo (fried confit of pork belly). It was all great - food that is regional and prepared with skill and creativity. The mussels, Oreja and Torrenzo were exceptional. The price is very reasonable - about 30 euros and I was stuffed. A real gem.

title_review: Fantastic steak ‚Äì a great taste of Argentina in Spain
review_preview: We had one of our best meals in Madrid on our first night here. Our concierge recommended La Cabana Argentina when we asked for a restaurant within walking distance (and told him that, after being in Spain for three weeks, we were tired of jamon);...
review_full: We had one of our best meals in Madrid on our first night here. Our concierge recommended La Cabana Argentina when we asked for a restaurant within walking distance (and told him that, after being in Spain for three weeks, we were tired of jamon); it is located on a charming, narrow street with several other restaurants. Golden light shines on the street through the big plate glass windows that display various cuts of steak, and the atmosphere is inviting: white-washed exposed brick featuring mirrors and old photos, charcoal grey leather banquets lining the walls, dangling lights, crisp white tablecloths. The service was excellent. Shortly after being seated, we were served bread and three kinds of olives. And the servers were attentive throughout the evening ‚Äì moving efficiently through the very busy restaurant ‚Äì but not cloying. And, the most important thing: the steaks were fantastic. A father and son own and operate the place, which has been around for more than 20 years, and import vacuum-packed Argentine loins and cuts twice a week. The quality is evident. We both ordered rib eyes and they were cooked a perfect medium rare and were tender and buttery. We share a massive salad with Roquefort cheese, walnuts, apples, tomatoes and a platter of golden, crispy fries. The wine list has a large selection of Argentinian Malbecs and Spanish reds, as well as a smaller but thoughtfully curated selection of other reds, blends, whites, sparkling (cava!) and dessert wines. Even though we were extremely full, we shared the dulce de leche ice cream ‚Äì three large scoops of rich, creamy, caramel delight. We were very content as we walked back to our hotel ‚Äì only wishing it was a bit further away so we could expend a few more of the many calories we had just joyously imbibed.

The beer tap got clogged and it took them a bit to clear up. By 20:30 it was busy. The meal was the boquerrones and anchoas tapa. Wow 1st time I tried them like that and they were outstanding. Then their house special Torrezno, very tasty but very heavy and well presented. Desert, which they insisted I try, passion fruit mousse. Oh my.... words can't explain this desert. I very highly recommend this place but not just for a stop over. You need at least 3 or 4 meals to try the entire menu.

title_review: Mussels so good we ordered them twice!
review_preview: My travel companion and I called on Saturday for a 9pm booking, and I'm so glad we did! First, because I think we secured the last 2 seats, and second, because the food was incredible.We started with the mussels in kimchi broth, and they...
review_full: My travel companion and I called on Saturday for a 9pm booking, and I'm so glad we did! First, because I think we secured the last 2 seats, and second, because the food was incredible. We started with the mussels in kimchi broth, and they were cooked to perfection, and yes, the broth is so good. We also had the pork belly, which was also so flavorful. Yet as we were eating, we were still a little hungry, so we placed a second order for mussels. They are so good! The staff was amazing. They were all running around taking care of everyone. You can imagine how busy it is on a Saturday night, and yet we didn't feel ignored. I also didn't feel any issue with our lack of Spanish skills, they were so accommodating.  We finished the evening with the chocolate dessert with berries. It was a perfect end to our Spanish adventure. Do check these guys out as they are the real deal.

review_preview: After a week of great food we had resigned ourselves to a last dinner of airport food when we found this place. At first it didn‚Äôt look open, there is not much on the outside. Opens right at 8pm and only holds 25-30 people so...
review_full: After a week of great food we had resigned ourselves to a last dinner of airport food when we found this place. At first it didn‚Äôt look open, there is not much on the outside. Opens right at 8pm and only holds 25-30 people so fills quickly. The service was quick and friendly and they have an English menu if needed. Their food is spectacular and features a mix of solid Spanish classics and new twists. The mussels in kimchi broth were divine so save some bread to use to sop the broth us with. I have no idea how they prepared the artichokes- entire small artichokes splayed out and cooked with jamon and such, just great. Also had the patatas bravas which were fried crisp and the sauce was just spicy enough. The chocolate ganache desert was very nice-a bit different but great! Overall, everything was well above our expectations and was the perfect finish to a trip to Madrid.

review_preview: Stayed in Madrid and fancied a steak meal so popped on the trusted ‚ÄòTrip Advisor‚Äô and found this little gem ! What a place folks !! Waited a little while for a table but worth every second as the food is sublime.Started off with...
review_full: Stayed in Madrid and fancied a steak meal so popped on the trusted ‚ÄòTrip Advisor‚Äô and found this little gem ! What a place folks !! Waited a little while for a table but worth every second as the food is sublime. Started off with some bread and a little mix they had which was herbs, garlic and Oliver oil mixed together, on the bread it was awesome. Then into the plate of ham to share as a starter. Comes with plenty of ham (2 shared) and some toasted bread, again with the garlic it was lovely.  For mains we both ordered the rib eye (Angus) steak and it was perfect in every way. I love my steak houses and this again as in Romania is up with the very best. Served with a pepper sauce, fried with garlic and roasted red peppers it was such a lovely taste. Steak melted in your mouth, well worth the wait.  Cost:- well for all good, plenty of drinks it came to just ‚Ç¨120 which I may add was a snip considering how lovely it was. Service:- very good, staff always keen to make sure you had everything and were very polite. Overall:- a lovely night for either couples or families with children too. Try it, I assure you will not be disappointed. Any questions, just ask ! Thank you

review_preview: I walked by this place and glance at the menu after visiting the museum. I was looking for a spot with lighter fare options for a very late lunch and a few dishes on their menu caught my eye. So I decided to step in....
review_full: I walked by this place and glance at the menu after visiting the museum. I was looking for a spot with lighter fare options for a very late lunch and a few dishes on their menu caught my eye. So I decided to step in. First off, the staff here is wonderful. I was traveling solo (mid 40s female who only speaks about 20-30 words of Spanish), and from the beginning, despite my lack of Spanish language skills, everyone who works at this restaurant was very friendly and welcoming, and I did not feel at all awkward dining on my own or made to feel that I was holding up a table for a larger party. And judging by other people dining there, they serve a fairly diverse crowd. Service and hospitality was impeccable, efficient (without being overdone), and warm. Shout out to all of the friendly wait staff, and especially to Emilio, who offered a cinnamon-rice milk liquor to top off my salmon and avocado salad (which was also perfect). I also really liked the decor--it's warm, rustic, and very inviting. If you are looking for a change from regular tapas restaurants in the area (i.e. you are visiting the Reina Sofia or Prado Museum), I highly recommend this place. I would definitely go back again if I'm in the area and try some of their other dishes.

title_review: Innovative Food - Impeccable Service - Reasonable Price
review_preview: This trendy restaurant sits in a small side street by the Plaza Mayor in Madrid.  We had made a reservation for 8pm but showed up at 720pm.  The waiter/host Ibrahim was very kind to accommodate us near the bar in a table for two.  He...
review_full: This trendy restaurant sits in a small side street by the Plaza Mayor in Madrid. We had made a reservation for 8pm but showed up at 720pm. The waiter/host Ibrahim was very kind to accommodate us near the bar in a table for two. He was quick to offer us a courtesy taste of the pineapple daiquiri, the wine list and menu. Two other couples were sitting nearby. He took our order (and those of our neighbors) and shortly thereafter started parading our feast. We had the house red wine which was adequate, followed by an appetizer of croquettes which were recommended by Ibrahim. The corquettes were indeed fantastic. We also had the escalibada vegetables, but the eggplant was a bit too tough and it needed some sherry vinegar to enhance the flavor. That was the only part of our meal which was not excellent. We had the steak tartare and the braised lamb and both were amazing. To top things off, the chocolate extravaganza dessert was world class. Nothing however beats the service and attitude displayed by Ibrahim. This is a good place with a well deserved reputation. At one point a large group showed up without reservations and the staff seemed to bend over backwards to accommodate them, rather than playing snob and making it hard for the guests. That is classy! The price for our meal was reasonable and that is appreciated.

title_review: A small gem near Madrid Airport
review_preview: It wasn‚Äôt really a surprise given the reviews but after my wife and I found this little gem we left with smiles on our faces. Our host was gracious and helpful in explaining the small but perfectly focused menu. The food was like watching an...
review_full: It wasn‚Äôt really a surprise given the reviews but after my wife and I found this little gem we left with smiles on our faces. Our host was gracious and helpful in explaining the small but perfectly focused menu. The food was like watching an excellent fireworks display with each dish exploding with new flavors and textures. This was easily one of the best meals we had during our two weeks in Spain. Highlights: Tomato Alinado: carpaccio like slices, in a lovely savory vinaigrette, with strategically employed salt crystals and topped with dollops of a berry cream emulsion. We used up most of our bread sopping up the marinade. Incredible!  Flores de Alcachofa: perfect flowers of artichoke, seasoned perfectly and topped with quail eggs and pancetta. Just fantastic.  Calimari: fried in a light batter and seasoned with just a touch of vinaigrette and hair thin strands of Chile pepper, Cilantro and Cucumber.  Oreja El callejon: perfectly cooked pork belly with an amazing crackling crust. Sinfully luscious! Purple salt added just the right punch.  We also enjoyed an amuse of patatas bravas which were spicy and incredible.  Our host was very helpful with selection from their small but well curated wine list.  All in all we cannot recommend this Taberna highly enough. We wish them success in the future. If you are flying through or just in Madrid for business / holiday.. this Taberna is well worth seeking out. Given their popularity I would recommend making reservations. We got lucky at 2:15. By 3pm the place was full.

title_review: TripAdvisor was right. This is worthy of praise!
review_preview: We arrived in Madrid this evening for a departure early tomorrow. Based upon the TripAdvisor recommendations, we walked to this Taberna. It was an easy walk but at night, the last turn took us down a small street, better called an alley.  Half way down...
review_full: We arrived in Madrid this evening for a departure early tomorrow. Based upon the TripAdvisor recommendations, we walked to this Taberna. It was an easy walk but at night, the last turn took us down a small street, better called an alley. Half way down the alley, as view from the street, we found the Taberna El Callejon. It is small but quaint. In summary, we just got back from eating at this Taberna and we are totally satisfied with this place. First of all, the Bartender/Server Alex made the experience what it was. He speaks very good English. He took the time to explain each item on the menu then made some excellent recommendations. Every single tapa we ate was excellent, beyond our expectations. We had muscles cooked in a wok and served in a delicious broth. My wife is not a muscle eater. But she tried these and has become a convert. Artichokes that were grilled and topped with a quail egg were again excellent. The croquettes de bacalaou (cod fish) were delicate and creamy. I would not hesitate choosing this Taberna again.

review_preview: Having survived the Madrid marathon we were looking for a high quality restaurant as part of a celebration meal. In a city where excellent food and associated customer service are often a rarity, this restaurant really stands out. Metro Bistro offers fantastic food accompanied by...
review_full: Having survived the Madrid marathon we were looking for a high quality restaurant as part of a celebration meal. In a city where excellent food and associated customer service are often a rarity, this restaurant really stands out. Metro Bistro offers fantastic food accompanied by similarly excellent service. Ibrahim in particular Is a real gem, taking time to offer the multi national customers the benefit of his experience and advice. We would highly recommend this restaurant. If you haven't booked then arrive early as the tables are soon taken. Be prepared to spend a little more but it's well worth the investment.

title_review: Excellent service and great tasting food
review_preview: We went here for a late dinner.  Other restaurants ranked higher in the area were packed and needed reservations.  Metro Bistro had space and were very welcoming. It is not your traditional tapas/spanish restaurant you find in La Latina or near Plaza Mayor.  It had...
review_full: We went here for a late dinner. Other restaurants ranked higher in the area were packed and needed reservations. Metro Bistro had space and were very welcoming. It is not your traditional tapas/spanish restaurant you find in La Latina or near Plaza Mayor. It had traditional ingredients but reminded my wife and I of a smaller fine dining restaurant you would find in North America.  The servers spoke english fairly well and were very attentive and courteous. The music they played was also very trendy as my wife had to ask who the artist they were playing was. Order the assorted cheese, platter to start. The cheese selection is fantastic and goes well with the assorted fruit and house bread.  We also ordered the treasures of the sea. Which were deep fried escargot or muscles with seaweed salad. That was also very good, but not as good as the cheese. For entree's we ordered the steak tartare and the scallop risotto. Both were very well presented and the taste was excellent. The portions were not too large as we were able to finish them after our appetizers and not be completely stuffed. For dessert we had the pineapple cannelloni and the dulce de leche cheesecake. My wife was in love with the pineapple dish and almost ordered a second. The cheesecake was also very good. I could not finish it on the count of the large amount of dulce de leche on top of the cake. The flavour was amazing, just a lot of caramel to eat.

Overall we would like to highlight the kindness of the staff, specially Emilio from Ciudad Real who made us feel ourselves at home anytime, helping us to choose among a wide range of burratas and giving us his firsthand recommendations which is always useful when it comes to visiting a restaurant for the first time. In relation to the menu itself, there is a wide range of burrata and mozzarella, a delicious melanzane (eggplant with parmesan cheese and tomato sauce) and something that caught my eyes was the basket of fresh homemade bread.  Taking into consideration that it is an Italian cuisine, I would say it is the best value for money.  On the other hand, If I had to say something to be improved would be the space between tables, unfortunately it is being something as usual as uncomfortable. Holding more capacity not always imply more revenues. Anyway, Oven is highly recommended.

review_full: I held the reviews on this site with the utmost respect. However, I have been studying abroad in Madrid for 4 months now and my family is privileged enough that I have been to most high end restaurants in Madrid. This restaurant is a sham and offers a terrible meal. The location is excellent (which explains the number of reviews) and the service is adequate. However, for the restaurant to rank #38 in Madrid gives the city a bad name. I could name 50 restaurants off the top of my head that are 100% better than this dump. The pumpkin cream soup was cold, the croquettes were cold and flavorless, the salad had no substantial greens or vegetables, the cheese pots consisted of two okay cheeses and 4 inedible ones. DO NOT BE FOOLED BY LOCATION!!!! THIS IS NOT GOOD SPANISH FOOD OR GOOD FOOD IN MADRID PERIOD! I will be contacting someone on trip advisor to ask how they can stand for such a terrible restaurant being in the top 100 restaurant in Madrid. This is an anomaly to trip advisor! We went to Takos Al Pastor right next to it after for $1 tacos and quesadillas and that meal was one of the better I have had in Madrid. Metro bistro is garbage. Do not give your business your money. Much better restaurants should be in that location.

title_review: Great food at a great price. A must.
review_preview: You have to try the 7 course tasting menu, which actually works out about 9 course with some little extras. Each course was amazing, interesting and very tasty. And at 38 EUR each its superb value. Service too was impeccable. Overall with wine and some...
review_full: You have to try the 7 course tasting menu, which actually works out about 9 course with some little extras. Each course was amazing, interesting and very tasty. And at 38 EUR each its superb value. Service too was impeccable. Overall with wine and some fizz it was 108 EUR for my wife and I. The only gripe I really have is the fact Metro Bistro offers fine dining but is still a bit of a bar type vibe - I had music from the entrance in one ear and nothing in the other, I think some cool chill out music played throughout would add to the experience. Also there was a group of lads on a stag do a few tables away and although they were fine (if not a little rowdy) it would have been a better experience if it was couples or maybe no more than groups of 5.  With these above areas of improvement I would have given it 5 stars, great service, superb food. A must for any visitor to Madrid.

review_preview: Our group of 6 enjoyed a taste of Argentina at dinner at this venue.This restaurant has been established for some 20 years but was refurbished two years ago to great effect. The internal part rustic brickwork contrasts with smooth marble sections of the walls...
review_full: Our group of 6 enjoyed a taste of Argentina at dinner at this venue. This restaurant has been established for some 20 years but was refurbished two years ago to great effect. The internal part rustic brickwork contrasts with smooth marble sections of the walls and gives a warm and comfortable feel. There is a relatively large seating capacity and it quickly filled with a mixture of groups and couples. The service, with some Argentinian personnel, was of a high standard. Paula's advice on the wine list was appreciated. Both the menu and wine list are comprehensive and easy to read. Of course the steak listing in the Menu is large with related meat sizes to show the extent of the meal. We were served olives, dip and bread to start. We did not require starters and went to the main courses which were either the beef tenderloin (300gram) or the rib eye steak.  The quality of the meats were excellent, and whilst nearly all of our party asked for the cooking to be "medium" the steaks were served more what we would class as "rare" in Australia. We were forewarned by Paula that the steaks would be cooked to a "pink" colour.  However all enjoyed the steaks very much and the accompanying saut√©ed vegetables, shared between two, were of good variety and servings. For our wines we chose an Argentinian Chardonnay and Malbec, both of which were reasonably priced and well suited our tastes. Overall a very enjoyable and memorable experience. A Booking is certainly recommended.

review_preview: First of all, if you plan to eat here, you should definitely have a reservation. Otherwise it is almost impossible to find a seat. Like all restaurants in Spain, they are almost fully booked between 20:00-23:00, so either you have to visit earlier or book...
review_full: First of all, if you plan to eat here, you should definitely have a reservation. Otherwise it is almost impossible to find a seat. Like all restaurants in Spain, they are almost fully booked between 20:00-23:00, so either you have to visit earlier or book a table in advance. We have been to La Cabana to try steak and we did not regret it. We have been there around 19:00 without any reservation. They were fully booked for 20:00 afterwards and gave us a table on condition that we would leave latest at 20:30 which was ok for us since we had another plan later at night.  The staff was kind and friendly. But unfortunately not all of them could speak English. A waitress took our orders for drink and salad. When we asked a few things about the salad, an English speaking waitress had to come over to answer but it was ok. After our order was taken, a service plate with olive, a very good olive oil and some other oily spicy sauce was served to us. While we were trying the olive oil, a waiter came by and took our orders. We have tried two different steaks, one of which was recommended by the waiter and wanted half portion grilled vegetables. Though they were quite slow in serving and it took about half an hour for our dishes to be served, the steaks were really good. Surprisingly, the salad was above our expectations as well. Thus, we spent around 1.5 hours there enjoying our food and left the restaurant with smiling faces.

review_preview: It snowed in Madrid today, we were out walking and cold.  This place showed up on TA and we made our way to it.I don't know if it was just that we were cold and hungry, but we were, literally, blown away by our...
review_full: It snowed in Madrid today, we were out walking and cold. This place showed up on TA and we made our way to it. I don't know if it was just that we were cold and hungry, but we were, literally, blown away by our experience here. We were welcomed gracefully and warmly. Staff is unpretentious, kindly and efficient without being overweening. The food was excellent, from the bread box and butter cover, to the Cecina starter (which we shared), to my Perla Negra and My wife's Hamburguesa de Ternera, we just sat, ate and marvelled at the quality and the tastes.  The Cecina is thinly sliced cured veal with cream cheese and tomato. A fine blend of different flavours that lingered on the palate. And, there was lots for both of us.  My Perla was three scallops on a 'boat' of black rice in a shallow 'sea' of a curry sauce that was really quite indescribably good. I ate it all, savouring each bite and hoping it would go on and on.  My wife's hamburguesa was like no hamburger we have ever experienced. I have to admit that when I saw it on the menu, I began to have second thoughts about the kind of place we had come to. But, really, this is nothing like any other version of a hamburger we have ever seen. The meat perfectly seasoned, done just right. No bread, just finely shaped, amazingly crisp and tasty sliced of Yucca. (I know, who would ever have thought!) All put together beautifully artistically and very appealing. We had glasses of the house red together to start and I had a glass of house white and, really, if I had picked the most expensive bottles in the house, I could not have picked better myself. The d√©cor is clean, elegant and comfortable and matches the food. What I cannot believe is that (apart from a group of six Spaniards who came in to share wine and olives while we were there), we were the only people in the place. At 13:45, I don't think we were unfashionably early for lunch. Perhaps it had more to do with this being a Thursday on an exceptionally cold - and snowing - day when few tourists or Madrilenos were venturing out when they did not absolutely have to do so. I try not to give out five stars unless a place is really exceptional in our experience. There is just too much review inflation andhyperbole out there what with all the 'Amazing's, 'Awesome's and 'Fantastic's one sees over and over again. Let me just say this place is excellent and to be highly recommended. You are unlikely to go wrong. On food, on wine, or on the cost of your meal.

This was a great meal and I would happily return.

review_preview: Metro Bistro is located behind Plaza Mayor - almost hidden amongst other shops and restaurants vying for attention. review_full: Metro Bistro is located behind Plaza Mayor - almost hidden amongst other shops and restaurants vying for attention. Once inside, however, you are in the world of fine dining and delightful food prepared with due care. The service was attentive and enthusiastic. Everyone working in Metro Bistro really cares about ensuring you have a great dining experience and about presenting beautiful food. The experience of having many small courses over the evening is exquisite. The food is quite a picture of presentation and the taste is amazing as the flavours and colours and, yes, even the textures are thoughtfully and artfully combined. The black rice and squid is a firm favourite. However the chocolate plate is a triumph of mastery over the craft - too beautiful for words! - although we didn't take long to start to eat our way though the different gorgeous chocolate concoctions. Chef Matias Smith spends time with patrons during the course of the evening and is so keen to ensure that everyone is enjoying their food - a wonderful touch.

I had for main course a hamburger which was actually 2 patties made of veal and bacon on bed of sweet little onions, camembert cheese and yucca. Across from me one of my companions had the steak tartare which was also very nicely presented. For desert, we shared the "TRIBUTE TO CHOCOLATE": Truffles ‚ÄúBomb√≥n‚Äù, half cold with Sansho-Ko pepper, ganache Peta Z and cocoa mousse (copied from the restaurant website). The desert was good enough reason to go the Metro Bistro!!! The food was very good and the service was also excellent as expected and as noted in other reviews. I was also surprise to see the prices were also very reasonable. Overall, I highly recommend.  One word about our acquaintance with the chef/owner, that particular evening he wasn't there so I don't think that we got any special treatment because of that.

title_review: Argentina in the center of Madrid
review_preview: We lived for 4 days in the real center of Madrid - Plaza Santa Ana. A vibrating area with numerous nice Spanish restaurants. But after much Spanish food in the recent days we looked for a steak house. Tripadvisor gave us the hint for this...
review_full: We lived for 4 days in the real center of Madrid - Plaza Santa Ana. A vibrating area with numerous nice Spanish restaurants. But after much Spanish food in the recent days we looked for a steak house. Tripadvisor gave us the hint for this Argentine restaurant just 100 m away. They have a good choice of Argentine meat, different cuts and sizes of 300g or 500g. It was cooked as we wished (medium rare) and with different side dishes. Service was nice and attentive. A short advice: Even when you are hungry, share the salad with your partner, it is really large. If you intend to eat later than 21 o'clock, I think a reservation is mandantory. At the end we got a low bill for all we have eaten. Okay this is the sight of a Swiss and we have another measure. All together: If you are in the center of Madrid and tired of all the Spanish food, this is the place.

title_review: Very good Italian food, great service
review_preview: When you‚Äôre in Spain, not every meal has to be tapas. We ate here after a week of fantastic tapas and we just wanted something, well, not tapas. Given the area, we were expecting something very touristy, expensive and mediocre, so imagine our surprise when...
review_full: When you‚Äôre in Spain, not every meal has to be tapas. We ate here after a week of fantastic tapas and we just wanted something, well, not tapas. Given the area, we were expecting something very touristy, expensive and mediocre, so imagine our surprise when the food turned out to be quite good and not exorbitant. In addition, the service was exceptional. Emilio greeted us at the door (think ‚Äúyoung James Spader‚Äù), and we were in good hands for the rest of the evening. He patiently tolerated our broken Spanish with a smile and happily switched to English when we ran out of vocabulary. There‚Äôs only so much a waiter at a restaurant in a touristy area can do, and he checked all of the boxes: patient, accommodating, pleasant, efficient, friendly. 5 stars for you, Emilio!

title_review: The clue is in the name!
review_preview: Steaks and burgers. If you're looking for either of these then you'll find them at Steakburger Atocha - and the quality is high!We booked off the back of the good reviews on here as were strolling around the botanical gardens, which are just up...
review_full: Steaks and burgers. If you're looking for either of these then you'll find them at Steakburger Atocha - and the quality is high! We booked off the back of the good reviews on here as were strolling around the botanical gardens, which are just up the road from the restaurant. The gardens, by the way, are well worth a visit. There were four of us and two had the chicken burger, one had the Mexican burger, and I had steak.  The steak was cooked really well, I asked for medium/rare and got just that, and the fries were great. It was just what I wanted to satisfy my steak urge! The burgers, I am told, were amongst the best they have had. The little pot of peppers which came with the steak are worth mentioning - they went really well with the meat and were something I hadn't had before with steak. So all in all we were very happy. As for the restaurant itself, a lovely atmosphere, not too big and not too small, very friendly staff and a house red which was delicious! I think if we were here longer we may well have gone back to Steakburger Atocha.

title_review: Wonderful evening, amazing steak, fantastic service
review_preview: La Cabana advertises itself as the best Argentinian restaurant in Madrid on its website, and whilst I can't directly compare it to others in the city, I can't see how they could better the meal my husband and I had at La Cabana (Oct 2016)....
review_full: La Cabana advertises itself as the best Argentinian restaurant in Madrid on its website, and whilst I can't directly compare it to others in the city, I can't see how they could better the meal my husband and I had at La Cabana (Oct 2016).  A warm welcome by the proprietor (even though we had not reserved a table), top notch service from the staff throughout the evening, and amazing, amazing steak - one of the best we have ever had.  It is a bit more expensive than many restaurants in the City (300g steak was just over 19 euros without any accompanying dishes which had to be bought over and above) but it was well worth it from our point of view; the welcome, the service, the restaurant itself, and the food were of a standard I would expect when paying that bit more.  I definitely recommend this restaurant for an evening meal. I would advise booking; we got lucky turning up out of the blue I think, as it seems to be a relatively busy restaurant - which also tells you all you need to know about the quality of the food being served; if it wasn't good, no one would go there! Enjoy!

review_preview: Metro Bistro is great, hip, friendly, modern, foodlovers' place just off the Plaza Mayor, where most other things are way-more old-school.  It's open for both lunch and dinner, and dinner can be had starting at 7:00, a great thing for gringos like us who don't...

It's open for both lunch and dinner, and dinner can be had starting at 7:00, a great thing for gringos like us who don't want dinner between 9:30 and 11:00 at night. The food is excellent, the service warm and attentive (server Miguel speaks many language, including English, well). The starters are ALL great; the butterfish, pork, and scallops entrees particular standouts; even the bread and butter table-services special Not to be missed, in our view.

review_preview: We had a late dinner at Steakburger Atocha in June 2019.  The food that we got was tasty and plentiful, and the staff were friendly, but multiple logistical problems with the service made the experience somewhat disappointing.  A high noise level (from other diners‚Äô conversations,...
review_full: We had a late dinner at Steakburger Atocha in June 2019. The food that we got was tasty and plentiful, and the staff were friendly, but multiple logistical problems with the service made the experience somewhat disappointing. A high noise level (from other diners‚Äô conversations, not music) also contributed negatively. To begin with, the server (who spoke fluent English) said he could provide tap water with ice, but then brought bottled water at 2 Euros each. Not a big deal, since most restaurants in Madrid will not serve tap water anyway, but we should have been given accurate information. For food, we ordered a goat cheese salad, a red mountain burger, a melting cheese burger, and the marinated grilled chicken. The melting cheese burger never arrived. The serving of grilled chicken was so large, however, that by the time we realized the melting cheese burger wasn‚Äôt just delayed but omitted, it was clear we had enough food without it. When we pointed out the omission to the server, he apologized, removed the missing burger from the bill, and also brought us a complimentary dessert (a large, oven-fresh cookie with ice cream).  We get that in Europe, diners tend to linger in restaurants, and one has to ask explicitly for the check, but in this case we had to ask three times for the check, with long time intervals between requests. Again, not a big deal, but it reinforced our impression that we weren‚Äôt a very high priority table. The restrooms were clean, but down a long flight of stairs and therefore inaccessible to those in wheelchairs or otherwise unable to manage the stairs. The temperature in the dining room was pleasantly cool on a rather warm evening.

title_review: A Modern Take on Traditional Mediterranean Cuisine
review_preview: We decided on this restaurant for a quick lunch in the city during a long layover in Barajas. The service was top-notch. They made a point of clearly explaining every dish, even their interesting selection of various types of homemade bread and butter. I had...
review_full: We decided on this restaurant for a quick lunch in the city during a long layover in Barajas. The service was top-notch. They made a point of clearly explaining every dish, even their interesting selection of various types of homemade bread and butter. I had the risotto venere, while my partner had the steak tartare. Both were very tasty, although the tartare was far more conceptual and creative with its use of non-traditional ingredients such as foie-gras and caviar. We both had the creamy cheesecake for dessert, and it did not disappoint. All in all, it was an upscale experience that is recommended to anyone who enjoys creative and service-oriented dining.

review_preview: We had Christmas Eve dinner package, about 60 euro per person. One of the best meal we had during the trip in Spain! The dishes' re international style, not big serving each dish, but the whole package's  overwhelmingÔºåeveryone in the family had at least one...
review_full: We had Christmas Eve dinner package, about 60 euro per person. One of the best meal we had during the trip in Spain!  The dishes' re international style, not big serving each dish, but the whole package's overwhelmingÔºåeveryone in the family had at least one favorite one.  Menu: cold appetizers(cocktail, and two dishes), warm appetizers(3 of them, poularde crispy roll is our favorite), Main course ' re lobster over salmon tartar and tomatoes cream (my favorite), and lamb gigot with chestnut and black mushroom, desserts started with mango mousse, and ended with a tray of different types of Chocolate. After dinner, came a glass of sparkling white wine, and many candies (Turron and mazapan)! You should see every guest's face, everyone's beaming with joy! The service's great, love the hostess and the waiter. title_review: A pretentious restaurant - but well worth a visit
review_preview: We ate here on a wet Sunday evening and were the first diners at 7.30 pm.  The restaurant is modernistic and chic and initial thoughts were 'oh no, not another pretentious eaterie'.  However, having ordered the risotto (comprising Chinese black rice and scallops) and the...
review_full: We ate here on a wet Sunday evening and were the first diners at 7.30 pm. The restaurant is modernistic and chic and initial thoughts were 'oh no, not another pretentious eaterie'. However, having ordered the risotto (comprising Chinese black rice and scallops) and the veal and bacon burger, we were delighted with the meals delivered. Yes, the portions are very small and delicate and decoratively presented, but were extremely tasty, and with the fabulous variety of breads to accompany the meals, were sufficient to feed a hungry tourist. Desserts were delightful and sheer works of art - should have been at the Prado! So - not the place if you are looking for fast food and are starving, but if you have finer tastes, give them a try. you won't be disappointed.

Service was great from the beginning, till we left. We had a short wait at the bar until a table became available. It was worth it! The food was phenomenal! Two of the best steaks I have tasted in a long time, cooked to perfection for both of us. A great wine to accompany the meal. Dessert fantastic too! I can't rate this place highly enough and wish we hadn't found it on our last night. Not the cheapest option around, but we left very happy with what we paid. I would recommend booking a table, as seats were not empty for long through the entire course of our meal.

review_preview: Me, my wife and son went for a visit to Madrid last weekend. I read the recommendations at Tripadvisor and made a reservation for last Sunday. It realy was a great food experience. The restaurant was modern but cosy. Every course was friendly introduced by...
review_full: Me, my wife and son went for a visit to Madrid last weekend. I read the recommendations at Tripadvisor and made a reservation for last Sunday. It realy was a great food experience. The restaurant was modern but cosy. Every course was friendly introduced by Ibrahim.  We started with Artisan Croquettes filled with clams and Mushrooms and served with Catalonian Sauce and the Baked Vegetables Salad. Both dishes were great but the specialty from the house, the Croques were very tasty and original. For the main course we took the Gigot Lamb, Braise Butter Fish and Steak with purple French potatoes, I dont think the last one was on the menu. All dishes were great but we really loved the steak and Butterfish. At last we ordered the Triibute to Chocolate, which is really a must for chocolate lovers? Pure chocolate with Pepper, Truffles, Liquid chocolate. A real intens chocolate sensation.  Also the apple Tart Crumble was anything you would expect from a classic apple crumble but an original tasty creation. Altogether we had a great night and it has been a great food sensation, friendly guided by Ibrahim and the staff. Metro Bistro would be one of the main reasons to vist Madrid again. Daniel, Tatik and Stefan

review_preview: My husband and I stumbled on La Cabana and decided to try it.  They were packed and told us they didn't have a table for another hour or so - which would have been after 10.  We asked if we could eat at the bar...
review_full: My husband and I stumbled on La Cabana and decided to try it. They were packed and told us they didn't have a table for another hour or so - which would have been after 10. We asked if we could eat at the bar and they were happy to accommodate us. All of the staff was friendly and welcoming. They grill all the meats right in front of you. There were so many delightful dishes on the menu. We went with the Short ribs and the skirt steaks - oh my! they know how to cook meat. Since my husband sometimes gets mistaken for a certain celebrity (picture attached you can judge for yourself) the staff all wanted a picture with him.  After dinner, we made reservations to come back two nights later. We had the sausage appetizer - absoletely amazing and then the chicken and pork for dinner. Wonderful choices as well. Given that we were only in Madrid for 4 days - to eat at the same restaurant twice in that short period of time tells you how good we thought the food was. Do NOT miss La Cabana if you like Argentinian food!

title_review: Looking for Something More than Tapas ?
review_preview: This was a rare find in the land of Iberian ham. One of our group walked past this restaurant during the day and said we should try it, not knowing how good it was going to be. A group of 6 arrived at 7.30pm with...
review_full: This was a rare find in the land of Iberian ham. One of our group walked past this restaurant during the day and said we should try it, not knowing how good it was going to be. A group of 6 arrived at 7.30pm with no reservation, I think we were the first diners there, but no problem, Paula our hostess arranged a setting for us. The restaurant at night, looking down the small lane did not stand out , but on arrival looking at the meat display in the window and the welcoming interior, one knew this was a restaurant operated by people that knew what it was about. This Argentinian Steak House had been operating for about 22 years and had been recently renovated to have an historical/modern theme which was very appealing and comfortable. All the right ingredients, Angus certified beef cuts, Argentinian Chardonnay and Malbec wines as will as Spanish offerings. The steaks were char grilled to European standards and very well too, but if you don't like really blue steaks then adjust your request from say medium rare to medium. Our group had rib eye steaks and tenderloins based on size of 300 grams and we added some share plates of saut√©ed vegetables which were fresh and delicious. Most had a dessert or cheese plate to finish and while we were waiting for our meals we had some bread, olive oil and olives. 3 bottles of wine, 3 beers, the meals and tip came to ‚Ç¨270 - ‚Ç¨90 a couple. I felt this was reasonable value given the service provided, the meal provided and the ambience of the restaurant. I would recommend this restaurant if you like a good steak but be sure to make a reservation so you are not disappointed.

It was delicious. Price was not unreasonable and were filled up when we left. Not a lot of English spoken here, but we have learned to expect that except in extremely touristy areas.  Totally enjoyable experience if a hunk of beef is what you're craving.

review_preview: Dined here a couple of nights ago and was really impressed with the quality of food as well as the top notch service, without forgetting the vast array of wine on offer on the wine list.The food on offer was exceptional. For starters we...
review_full: Dined here a couple of nights ago and was really impressed with the quality of food as well as the top notch service, without forgetting the vast array of wine on offer on the wine list. The food on offer was exceptional. For starters we opted to share the cheese platter, the cured veal, the croquettes (filled with Mushrooms and Ham) and the sea treasures which consisted of deep fried anemones with deep fried seaweed and a seaweed tartar. The latter was the pick of the lot - although all the dishes were good. However the contrast of the hot and crunchy anemones with the cold seaweed was just too good. For mains I had the Steak Tartar which was out of this world. It came dressed with truffle, egg, foie-gras and vegetables - with the truffle being the pick of the lot. One of my colleagues also took this whilst another took the burger which does not come served in a bun however the taste of the meat is unlike any burger I have tasted before (yes - I did manage to steal a bite!) Service on the night was exceptional and I hope to return next time I will be in Madrid.

review_preview: Being a foodie with a long history of gastronomique meals in France, where I live, and around the globe, this was my best meal experience in 5 days in Madrid. I was counting on Bodega de Los Secretos (which I booked in advance to celebrate...
review_full: Being a foodie with a long history of gastronomique meals in France, where I live, and around the globe, this was my best meal experience in 5 days in Madrid. I was counting on Bodega de Los Secretos (which I booked in advance to celebrate my mother's birthday) for the special meal (see my review) but Metro Bistro totally exceeded my expectations. The name doesn't give it justice - it is basically a gourmet restaurant (both in the sense of inventive cuisine and top notch service) at a ridiculously cheap price (for this level of cuisine). We had a 7 course tasting menu for 38 euros. We were the first people in the restaurant as we came at 7PM - we didn't have lunch and wanted to eat early; so we got so much attention from the staff we felt like at the Ritz. The presentation, the attention to detail, the great, yet unexpected combinations of ingredients (anemones with seaweed tartar and lemongrass took time to identify)... It all started with complimentary tiny celery mojitos and then one course gave way to the next one and next one. When we thought we couldn't possible eat anything else, the dessert arrived: pineapple cannelloni with mango source. The chocolate selection that accompanied coffee after that was definitely over the top. If you come here for that tasting menu, make sure you don't eat for few days before. The staff was wonderful, friendly and very professional: they explained every course in details, offered great wine suggestions and even packed the little chocolates for us to take away.  Just off Plaza Major, this fantastic restaurant is not to be missed. I can't wait to be back!

review_preview: After visiting its sister branch at Gran Via, we‚Äôve visited this one in the evening for rather light dinner.Much smaller than Gran via, but food is as good as there.Smaller branch means less tables and in a way it did reflect on the...
review_full: After visiting its sister branch at Gran Via, we‚Äôve visited this one in the evening for rather light dinner. Much smaller than Gran via, but food is as good as there. Smaller branch means less tables and in a way it did reflect on the atmosphere, which compared between the two is rather more settled down and quiet. We went for lobster ravioli (raviolacci de langosta) and beef ravioli (Ravioli de ternera braseada). The lobster pasta was very nice, with quite a hint of garlic, very tasty. I really loved the beef ravioli, with creamy sauce and sweet dried tomatoes. Very nice. I took also a margarita pizza to take with us as a little snack at the hotel and again, very good result. The dough is very thin, crispy and soft at the same time, coming with a bit of burrata melted on the top, with several basil leaves, leaving it with nice aroma. Service quick, attentive and friendly, definitely spot on!

Everyhting we ordered was not only beautiful on the plate, but absolutely delicious. The crunchy anemones, the versatile salad, the black pearl risotto with scallops, the lamb and the pineapple cannelloni just wonderful. The waiter was charming and the service impeccable. What a lovely first dinner in Madrid. Recommend it and would go back in a minute!

Initially, we were disappointed that we were directed to sit at the bar (because we didn't have reservations); however, our excellent waiter made up for the lack of a seat at a table. Each and every course was amazing! We chose the scallops with black rice for our main entree. The waiter explained in detail what we were eating. For dessert, I had the pineapple filled with frozen yogurt, and my husband had a delightful assortment of chocolate desserts. All I can say is "Wow". The restaurant was filled with Americans, so Tripadvisor must be directing all of us overwhelmed tourists to decent restaurants. Thank you.

title_review: Can I have another bite of this pineapple canneloni , please?
review_preview: We chose Metro Bistro  for our last dinner  in Madrid and we  couldn't have enjoyed it more. Situated just off wonderful Plaza Mayor, it is rather simple in appearance - not fancy but pleasant.  It appears that the staff - from chef Matias Smith to...
review_full: We chose Metro Bistro for our last dinner in Madrid and we couldn't have enjoyed it more. Situated just off wonderful Plaza Mayor, it is rather simple in appearance - not fancy but pleasant. It appears that the staff - from chef Matias Smith to the waiters- is international something that apparently works wonders. Our waiter , adorable Ibrahim, nice and friendly while at the same time knowledgeable , was definitely a plus to a delightful dinner. Everything we tasted was very good ( it would be difficult to mention the names in English,since I asked for the Spanish menu) but one dish stands out and shouldn't be missed: THE BEST dessert ever: the pineapple canneloni ! thin slices of pineapple wrapped around semi freddo yogurt and served with mango sauce : to die for!! It is this dish that qualifies Metro Bistro as excellent .

review_preview: We had a fabulous meal at Metro Bistro.  And, being North Americans, we appreciated being able to make a dinner reservation for an earlier time than the typical Madrid dinner!  The cuisine was very interesting, featuring creative combinations of food which were healthy and delicious....
review_full: We had a fabulous meal at Metro Bistro. And, being North Americans, we appreciated being able to make a dinner reservation for an earlier time than the typical Madrid dinner! The cuisine was very interesting, featuring creative combinations of food which were healthy and delicious. We shared a starter of their featured sea anemone with Asian greens, after reading about it on TA. It was quite a treat and probably something we'll never get again. For our first course, my husband had the pumpkin soup with cream and cheese and he loved it. I had a salad with figs and goat cheese which was also outstanding. For our main course, he had a slow cooked lamb with truffle sauce and I had scallops with black rice in a Ras El Hanout cream sauce. The flavors were all wonderful! Unfortunately, we didn't have room for dessert, but I'm sure it was terrific as well. The service was impeccable and for the quality of our meal, we thought it was reasonably priced. We recommended the restaurant to some friends who also said it was their best meal in Madrid.

review_preview: Our hotel recommended this restaurant as we had been in Spain for almost a week and wanted something other than tapas. La Cabana Argentina was perfect for our first night in Madrid, a steak house. We both split a La Cabana salad and then moved...
review_full: Our hotel recommended this restaurant as we had been in Spain for almost a week and wanted something other than tapas. La Cabana Argentina was perfect for our first night in Madrid, a steak house. We both split a La Cabana salad and then moved onto some French fries with garlic and parsley and shared some grilled Octopus while we were waiting for our steaks to be cooked to perfection. My favorite cut of meat is the Rib-eye and my other half choice is the Filet. La Cabana Argentina has a great grill master, they both came out juicy and perfect. If you're looking for a great steak while in Madrid, stop in, they know what they are doing.

title_review: Genuine Argentine cuisine and excellent service
review_preview: When a colleague of mine said that she fancied steak for dinner, a quick check on TripAdvisor led to booking a table at La Caba√±a. Given the great reviews, our expectations were high and we weren't disappointed. The empanadas, chorizo and provoleta we shared as...
review_full: When a colleague of mine said that she fancied steak for dinner, a quick check on TripAdvisor led to booking a table at La Caba√±a. Given the great reviews, our expectations were high and we weren't disappointed. The empanadas, chorizo and provoleta we shared as starters were all delicious and the three bifes de chorizo we had for mains were cooked perfectly and exactly as we had asked for them. The La Linda Malbec was one of the cheapest bottles on the wine list and a perfect match for our meal. I would happily recommend this restaurant to anyone.

review_full: So glad we read the reviews and ate here. Nine of us came for lunch and were made very welcome. We tried all of the starters between us and enjoyed all of them but especially the blood sausage and octopus. We had a variety of steaks ranging from rare to "no blood" and all were cooked to brilliantly and were so tender. As we were a large group we asked for a range of vegetables and potatoes to share and their was more than enough. The range of wines is impressive and the Malbec recommended was amongst the best we've had. Don't usually do deserts but you must try the apple crepe. The sugar caramelised on the plate and tasted like toffee apple with brandy to add. Great atmosphere and attentive service. Make sure you visit if you like top quality meat dishes.

review_preview: We ate here tonight to have something different from tapas although we do love Spanish food. La Cabana is 5 mins walk from Sol metro station so in the center of Madrid and in the heart of bars and restaurants. The interior is modern and...
review_full: We ate here tonight to have something different from tapas although we do love Spanish food. La Cabana is 5 mins walk from Sol metro station so in the center of Madrid and in the heart of bars and restaurants. The interior is modern and you can see the steaks being cooked from the window outside. We both had the fillet steaks, fries and salad to share which is more than enough as you won't need separate sides. Steaks were tender and melt in the mouth. For 2 main courses, 2 sides, bread, bottle of wine, soft drink and mineral water, bill came to ‚Ç¨100 euros including service which we thought was very good value. We definitely recommend La Cabana if you want a good steak.

Our table had both and all were delicious! I had the house specialty Steakburger with house sauce which contains mayo and a slight kick to it, I loved it. The beer was cold and the staff while initially seeming somewhat disinterested when we walked in at 1:30pm (we were the first people there apparently as it quickly filled up while we were eating)  The staff quickly got themselves in gear and were very attentive, offering additional drinks (something we had to ask for in most other places) and clearing our dirty plates without us asking! Loaded with locals and a place you won't go wrong in if you need a break from tapas!

review_preview: I fancied a steak so did my usual and checked out Trip advisor from the hotel to see what was about. Some of the restaurants by the hotel looked nice but the reviews were not good then I spotted Steak Burger Atocha. The reviews were...
review_full: I fancied a steak so did my usual and checked out Trip advisor from the hotel to see what was about. Some of the restaurants by the hotel looked nice but the reviews were not good then I spotted Steak Burger Atocha. The reviews were good and it was just round the corner. I didn't really fancy a burger but decided to give it a go anyway. First impression was good as we were taken to our table. Drinks order was taken straight away and we were given time to look at the menu. My fianc√© chose the Nachos to start and I had the chicken wings. The nachos was easily enough for both of us and were some of the best I've had. Could have been a bit spicier but my fianc√© saw to that with Tabasco. The chicken wings with the thick sweet sauce on the side were a star, sweet, crispy and cooked to perfection. For mains we both had steak. My fianc√© had medium and mine was rare and they were cooked to perfection. I almost went for the burgers but I am not a great burger fan as I like my Steak but when I saw some of them coming out for other tables they looked fabulous. Meal was finished of with Carrot cake and a complementary milky sweet alcoholicy drink which was really nice. All in all if you are in the Atocha area and looking for good food, Reasonably priced and good service do yourself a favour and give Steak burger a try. I'll certainly be going back next time I'm in Madrid.

title_review: Tasty, tantalizing and totally different from our ordinary dining experience
review_preview: We arrived at Metro Bistro with high expectations for great food, lively presentations and a fun night out.  Our expectations were exceeded on every level, with just one slight disappointment.  As a group of four, we chose the seven course tasting menu.  Each course was...
review_full: We arrived at Metro Bistro with high expectations for great food, lively presentations and a fun night out. Our expectations were exceeded on every level, with just one slight disappointment. As a group of four, we chose the seven course tasting menu. Each course was explained in advance by a member of the very attentive, personable and friendly staff. Dishes were somewhat customized, in one couse i had abolene added to a rissoto while others had it without. Same for a course where I tried eel.. Every plate was delicious, artfully presented and bursting with great flavor. Until our last main course which was the one dish we all knew, it was a sampling of pork tenderloin. Unfortunately, we all found it slightly undercooked and chewey. However, by that point in the meal, we were just fine with a small taste. Again the meal as a whole was fabulous  Two different dessert courses finished the meal on a very high note. Each taste of the desserts was exquisite. Higly recommend Metro Bistro and strongly suggest making a reservation in advance. The restaurant was very busy, for good reason.

title_review: Excellent steak and salad but the fries were too salty
review_preview: In Madrid on business and this is both close to where I am staying and was recommended. They managed to fit me in for an early dinner (by Spanish standards). I opted for the 300g rib-eye and fries. I figured a bit of salad would...
review_full: In Madrid on business and this is both close to where I am staying and was recommended. They managed to fit me in for an early dinner (by Spanish standards). I opted for the 300g rib-eye and fries. I figured a bit of salad would turn it into something approaching balanced. the cost of the salad should have warned me about the size of it... everything was lovely and fresh and the oil / vinegar complemented it well but was a bit too much in the end. The waitress brought over some bread that was both crusty and soft in the right places, although a shame that they appear to charge for this (albeit less than two euros). The rib-eye was cooked medium-rare, as requested and was the best I have had in a long while... full of flavour and well seasoned. Alas the sizeable portion of fries was also well seasoned and eaten together there was too much salt going on. If I was eating here again I would opt for the baked potato, which is finished on the grill, and find someone to share the salad with.

The other waiting staff were equally excellent throughout and spoke excellent english.  We had three courses all of which were superbly presented and tasty. The lamb was incredible. As was the fruit dessert.  Small plates of other bits and bobs were brought to us at different stages aswell as a shot of a celery mojito to start and a couple of shots of a local liqueur to end. All in all a wonderful meal and superb value with 3 courses each and a bottle of veuve cliquet (birthday treat) coming to just over ‚Ç¨100. If back in Madrid will 100% be back.

review_preview: Me and my wife were hunting around at the last minute to eat on the 30th of December, just before the Pre-Uvas, Then we found La Cabana, The meat on display in the front window done it for me. Now that may sound funny but...
review_full: Me and my wife were hunting around at the last minute to eat on the 30th of December, just before the Pre-Uvas, Then we found La Cabana, The meat on display in the front window done it for me. Now that may sound funny but the chef is cooking on an authentic grill in the window, one look and we were in like Flynn! We didn't have a booking and the place was busy, they said no problem and by the way the staff were super friendly. We actually are fluent in Spanish, but they insisted in speaking to us in perfect English. Whilst we waited we had a glass of wine at the bar and then shown our table. I had the steak and my wife the pork, both were fantastic and done to how we like it. The waitress actually took the time to explain how the meat would be cooked and how we would like it. The wine was Argentinian as well and normally in Spain it's well Spanish so this was great to try something new again. Highly, highly recommended. Great service, great value. will return!!

title_review: Great Steak - but a little rushed
review_preview: This is a great restaurant and naturally we were here for the steaks which were excellent.The only negative is that things just felt a little rushed.  Our waiter was keen to take our order seemingly 5 minutes after we'd sat down.  We had to...
review_full: This is a great restaurant and naturally we were here for the steaks which were excellent. The only negative is that things just felt a little rushed. Our waiter was keen to take our order seemingly 5 minutes after we'd sat down. We had to decline again a few minutes later. We shared a salad as a starter which was very nice but before we'd finished it our steaks had arrived and the remains of the salad had to go to make way for the mains. I can't recall ever having my food taken away from me before I'd finished. This was a Saturday night and the restaurant was quite busy but not full - although we noticed both tables either side of us turned over whilst we were there with new diners. There is a good choice of wines and beers and everything we had was very good. If the whole experience had been a bit more relaxed this would have been a 5 star review.

Service was great and the area was clean. A nice place for dining with family and friends.

title_review: Quality at very good prices with very good service
review_preview: I have been a regular to this restaurant for the last two years or so.  Paid some 6 or 7 visits there, always with clients / friends / project meetings.  The quality has always been very consistent, and the attention from the waiters is always...
review_full: I have been a regular to this restaurant for the last two years or so. Paid some 6 or 7 visits there, always with clients / friends / project meetings. The quality has always been very consistent, and the attention from the waiters is always superb. They'd explain every dish as it is served. And the food is always very nicely prepared and served. If you take into account the prices (and that they give you some extras here and there without asking for them), this place is a real bargain! Of course, prices may skyrocket if one starts drinking wine, but this is something that will happen anywhwere. All in all, a place to recommend.

Two of my friends commented that the steak they had in Argentina wasn't as tender as this! The ribeye was great, packed with flavor but don't order the 500g unless you have a friend that can finish it for you! The grilled peppers starter along with sausage was great but as usual I had too much fresh bread and didn't leave enough room for the whole meal. The staff were very friendly and attentive, service was smooth and accurate. The wine list had a good selection of Argentinian wine as well as Spanish. I would highly recommend for anyone to visit, a great experience.

review_full: Thanks again to the TA community for putting this gem on our radar screen. In particular, thanks to the reviewer who did not have a reservation but indicated that they were seated within a defined 90 minute time frame. We had the same experience, arriving at 8:30 p.m. and being told we could have a table till 10 p.m. Because the service is so attentive and prompt, we felt no pressure in having a great meal experience. My wife and I created a three-course shared meal, ultimately sharing and incredible 500 G stripsteak, perfect in every regard. There was a small plate charge for sharing. We opened with a Cherizo sausage and some grilled red peppers and shared a huge house salad as our intermediate course. Combined with a very affordable 2011 Rioja Reserva, our total bill was under $85 Euro before tip. Highly recommend this charming and excellent establishment.

review_preview: After a night out with friends, and having eaten at various tapas restaurants, we decided to stop at Metro Bistro for dessert at around 12:30pm. No matter, the staff received us with open, friendly, arms. Now, I have been a lover of traditional New York...
review_full: After a night out with friends, and having eaten at various tapas restaurants, we decided to stop at Metro Bistro for dessert at around 12:30pm. No matter, the staff received us with open, friendly, arms.  Now, I have been a lover of traditional New York cheesecake for as long as I can remember, and I'm invariably disappointed when fancy restaurants try to turn it into something that it is not meant to be. With that said, I can say that the Cheesecake I had at Metro Bistro is the best cheesecake I have ever had, and it is by no means a traditional Cheesecake. First of all, it comes in what looks something like a large Martini glass. Right there I was thinking, ok, here we go again, why can't restaurants leave the cheesecake alone. But then I took my first bite, and was transported to cheesecake heaven. It had the traditional cheesecake flavor we all love, infused with dulce de leche. It was simply superb. If you love cheesecake, by all means try this one.
