title_review: Sorry I didn't find this restaurant sooner.
review_preview: We have just returned from one one of the best meals we have had in 16 days throughout Spain.  I wish we had found it before our last night in Madrid.  While we have had some really good meals in Madrid, we would have substituted...
review_full: We have just returned from one one of the best meals we have had in 16 days throughout Spain. I wish we had found it before our last night in Madrid. While we have had some really good meals in Madrid, we would have substituted most of them for Metro Bistro Although we had read that it was hard to get into, because it was summer, not only did we get a reservation but there were plenty of seats all evening. First of all, the service was fantastic. Friendly, welcoming and seemed they were glad we were there. We had been a little concerned that most of the reviews talked more about the waiter Ibrahim and we thought maybe all the reviews were done by his family. Well, he was on vacation and the service was still great and we aren't members of his family pushing the restaurant. While not inexpensive, the portions are large and delicious. We were given a small cucumber mojito when we arrived. We split an appetizer of sliced veal that gives Iberico a run for it's money. We also split the slow roasted, low temperature lamb that was amazing. We finished with the chocolate dessert that was four different chocolate treats. They followed up with candy treats and limoncello. This is not your typical tapas restaurant so be prepared for a more leisurely meal with cloth napkins and tablecloths.  I don't understand why this restaurant is not higher on the list for TA but I would go back in a heartbeat. Just sad we can't do it this trip.

title_review: One of the best restaurants in Madrid.
review_preview: It is not surprising how highly this restaurant already ranks on tripadvisor but I believe it should be higher. My girlfriend and I visited this restaurant last night and we had such a fantastic experience I felt compelled to sign up to tripadvisor to share...
review_full: It is not surprising how highly this restaurant already ranks on tripadvisor but I believe it should be higher.  My girlfriend and I visited this restaurant last night and we had such a fantastic experience I felt compelled to sign up to tripadvisor to share it with everyone else.  I will separate the review into key areas: The Welcome: A warm and friendly greeting from the floor staff working that evening. We had no reservation which wasn't a problem and we were allowed to choose a table. The building is well decorated and modern providing a elegant atmosphere.  The Service: Exceptional care and time was given to us. Being the naive British tourists that we are, our Spanish is less than satisfactory. This was no problem for the staff who attempted to the best of their ability to translate and answer the many questions that we had. The food arrived promptly and we were given all kinds of complementary bits and pieces (explained in the food section). The Wine: The wine list is extraordinary! A few pages of whites and roses and an even bigger section of reds. These range from around Spain, France and the rest of the world. I chose an Argentinian Malbec for ‚Ç¨21.50 which is an average price on the menu, this was lovely. The large variety also comes with prices ranging from ‚Ç¨14 right up to ‚Ç¨260. You will definitely find a wine that you like on this menu.  The Food: The best part of the evening. The menu boasts a selection of starters including four options for vegetarians. There are around 7 main course options which include a variety of meat and fish. There is also the option to enjoy a 7 course tasting menu for ‚Ç¨38 per head. My girlfriend and I chose to order from the menu rather than try the tasting menu. Despite this we were given a stylish drink on arrival which we are still not sure what exactly it was but tasted amazing! Following this we were provided with a variety of breads consisting of normal white, spiced Peruvian and a subtle chocolate and orange version and all accompanied with olive and sage butters. Our starters of fois gras then arrived which was elegantly presented on a thin white plate with stylish and tasty decoration and was absolutely incredible. For our main course we chose the bacon and veal hamburger with fried yacca, caramelised onions and melted Camembert. If you have a big greasy burger pictured in your head then remove that image now! It was the best burger I've ever had. It consisted of two burgers of a veal and bacon blend. Between these was the fried yacca and the melted Camembert. They have chosen not to include a bun with the burger which is a fantastic idea and really adds to the flavour and presentation. For dessert I chose the caramelised pineapple filled with half frozen yoghurt and mango sorbet which was refreshing and light.  We were then provided with complementary sugar coated jellies one, amaretto and the other passion fruit.  The chef is nothing short of a genius with what they have done with the menu. The presentation and flavours were sublime, that can easily be compared to Michelin star standards. The price of all this luxury ‚Ç¨78, and I walked out of there feeling like I had robbed them.  I couldn't urge you enough to visit Metro Bistro if you are ever in Madrid.  Thanks for a wonderful evening!

title_review: Cosy restaurant with great tapas and cocktails
review_preview: El mini bar is a cosy and vintage tapas restaurant right in the centre of Madrid. I would recommend booking a day or two in advance as the restaurant gets extremely busy after 8pm with a queue that goes right out of the door (especially...
review_full: El mini bar is a cosy and vintage tapas restaurant right in the centre of Madrid. I would recommend booking a day or two in advance as the restaurant gets extremely busy after 8pm with a queue that goes right out of the door (especially on weekends).  Our hotel kindly booked a slot for us at 8:30pm however upon arrival the staff seemed to be a tad confused as the booking was under the hotels name and not ours. After a little back and forth of them telling us to come back at 11pm as we didn‚Äôt have a booking, eventually they found our reservation and we were seated... so the service at first impression wasn‚Äôt great.  We asked for a recommendation on how many tapas dishes to select and the waitress recommended 3-4 if we were very hungry, so that‚Äôs what we went with. We decided upon a mixture of the eggplant, chicken, boar and croquettes. All of which were amazing but especially the eggplant (the sauce that came with it was the best of the night). The dishes were also generous size portions and left us complete full! (They also provide all tables with complimentary bottled water and bread to go with the meals). To top off what was a great meal, the cocktails they provide are amazing. I had a few strawberry daiquiris and they are made quick and fresh straight to your table. If the restaurant/bar wasn‚Äôt so packed after our meal I would of definitely stayed just to have some more drinks. They worked out ‚Ç¨7.50 each which is great considering back home they would be around ¬£10 each.  I really wish I could rate this restaurant 5/5 however the service we received at the beginning was quite hostile and no dishes were brought to our table with a smile. Based purely off of service I have to rate El miniBAR 4/5 however the food and drinks quality overall was amazing and if you want good tapas, go here!

Also as many have already mentioned, it is more a takeaway store with around 6 bar seats available. Don't expect a full fledged restaurant.

review_preview: A friend and I stopped by Rosi La Loca for a drink and a bite to eat since we both had appointments in the city center. I knew the food was good, and my friend is a foodie. He loved it. Rosi La Loca puts...
review_full: A friend and I stopped by Rosi La Loca for a drink and a bite to eat since we both had appointments in the city center. I knew the food was good, and my friend is a foodie. He loved it. Rosi La Loca puts a modern spin on traditional Spanish dishes.  For COVID measures, they took our temperatures and contact information (for contact tracing) at the door and gave us hand sanitizer. There was a plastic barrier between all of the tables, and staff brought cutlery in plastic packaging, which they removed from the table immediately. The plastic packaging feels wasteful, but I understand the goal is to protect customers.  Cristina and Ismail were extremely attentive. Ismail speaks perfect English, and all of the staff quickly scanned our table for empty glasses/plates every time they passed.  I recommend Rosi La Loca to anyone visiting Madrid. It‚Äôs fun and friendly, and the food is delicious.

title_review: Fun place with interesting ways to present food
review_preview: The restaurant is on an alleyway that is not so inviting, but inside you are in a colorful and interesting environment. There's an upstairs and downstairs so the restaurant is bigger than you would think. I would not recommend sitting outside, the alleyway is not...
review_full: The restaurant is on an alleyway that is not so inviting, but inside you are in a colorful and interesting environment. There's an upstairs and downstairs so the restaurant is bigger than you would think. I would not recommend sitting outside, the alleyway is not nice. The sangria was great, loaded with fruit. The food comes very quick so don't order everything in one go else you'll have a table loaded with food. There are limited options for a vegetarian but we still managed. We started with the eggplant chips (really delicious) and the burrata salad (also delicious). The next two dishes were not my favorite - we ordered the smoky octopus, it was the whole octopus (not just the legs) and although well cooked I was turned off by parts of it - a bit gooey and chewy. The tuna tartar was also not to my taste, it was quite spicy and the red sauce took away from the natural tuna flavor. The desert was probably our best part of the meal - the tiramisu served in a coffee pot. It was really delicious, quite rich so one to share was perfect. It was a fun experience but I would not go back.

From the opening celery mohito drink to the amazing homage to chocolate, every serving was a new adventure. To name some highlights ..... sea anemones w/seaweeds, not one but three different ways; scallops w/Chinese black rice (rice was amazing!); sous vide gigot of lamb w/trompete de mort crisp mushrooms. And would my wife ever eat eel? Well ..... not sure .... a tiny taste and ... yes, if smoked and served in criss-cross strips over over a ratatouille with smoked vegetables. That is an adventure!!!! .

title_review: First visit great second visit not!
review_preview: It's a real shame really as our first visit here was brilliant we all had lovely food and a very pleasant evening. The place got really busy and it seemed like they were having difficulty in fitting everyone in as it was so popular. We...
review_full: It's a real shame really as our first visit here was brilliant we all had lovely food and a very pleasant evening. The place got really busy and it seemed like they were having difficulty in fitting everyone in as it was so popular. We enjoyed it so much we went back a few nights later and surprisingly was shown upstairs - we didn't know they had tables upstairs as we hadn't seen anyone go up there and it was a large seating area and very nice. Lovely young lady served our table and our night started off just as enjoyable as the first visit but then shockingly one of the chicken meals, which appeared to be cooked and was being eaten, turned out to be still frozen in parts!! This did spoil our night out as the worry then is have you got food poisoning. They did apologise and didn't charge for the one meal and did offer free desserts but by then the edge had been taken off the evening.

The food was really good both times though!

The sangria was delicious as well. Side note for those from the USA. Service is different in Spain as they take a more leisurely approach to dinner and be prepared to flag someone down if you want something as you may not see them again until it‚Äôs time to order coffee. It‚Äôs not personal, it‚Äôs just how it is. We enjoyed our food and would go back again.

For mains we had the Hen with satay sesame sauce and the beef and bacon burger with cheese and salsa sauce, both of which had wonderful flavours. The desert was mouthwatering, the apple tat crumble with vanilla ice cream. With one beer, bottle of water and two glasses of Rosado wine the meal came to 50 euros which was good value for money. Good friendly service and a most enjoyable evening meal. Regards Gary Saunders

I ended up ordering a steak while my wife ordered lobster ravioli and my daughter got lasagna. All three dishes were excellent and together with a bottle of wine, we had a great time. The cost for 3 dishes and bottle of wine was about 75 euros. I highly recommend this place if you want a nice sit-down dining experience.

title_review: Great Fusion Restaurant in the Plaza Mayor area
review_preview: We actually ate at this superb restaurant 2 times in a one week period.  The food is a fusion of "Spanish" dishes plus other foods and flavors, all very interesting but above all, appetizing and very delicious.  As you sit down, you are treated to...
review_full: We actually ate at this superb restaurant 2 times in a one week period. The food is a fusion of "Spanish" dishes plus other foods and flavors, all very interesting but above all, appetizing and very delicious. As you sit down, you are treated to a wonderful shot of celery drink, imagined by the great bartender. A combo of liquor and celery with a tiny little stalk in a shot glass, absolutely delicious! The entree selections are limited but all really delicious, with ample portions. The wait staff could not be nicer and more attentive! And for dessert, we first ordered the white chocolate cheesecake, which is more of a thick concoction with white chocolate strips. Have never tasted anything so delicious! Their flan is also wonderful! The prices were reasonable, considering the high overall quality of the selections, and their wine list is very nice. Highly recommend this wonderful restaurant, and, as mentioned, is right off the Plaza Mayor, where you can walk around in after a fabulous meal at this place.

review_full: We visited this restaurant twice during a recent break in Madrid. Our first visit was excellent, both service and food exemplary with a decent choice of dishes. So much so that we decided to cancel a reservation elsewhere and return another evening. Unfortunately on this occasion things were not quite so good. One of our party chose the chicken dish which was on the front ‚Äòspecials‚Äô page. He had virtually finished with just about a quarter of the chicken left when he found it was completely frozen. We were all flabbergasted as had never seen this before. The majority had appeared to be cooked ok but the last bit completely frozen. The staff were good and took the price of this dish off our bill and offered us a dessert but none of us could face eating anything else. So we paid and left and kept our fingers crossed that none of us went down with food poisoning. It was such a shame as it was supposed to be a special dinner to celebrate my birthday and it was completely ruined. Therefore I‚Äôm sorry but I can‚Äôt and daren‚Äôt recommend this restaurant.

title_review: Amazing food. The most rude server I‚Äôve encountered to date.
review_preview: Minibar came highly recommended by a friend that has lived in Madrid for sometime. I was very excited and was told you couldn‚Äôt go wrong. The friend was right for the most part, the food was incredible. We ordered a variety to cater for vegetarians...
review_full: Minibar came highly recommended by a friend that has lived in Madrid for sometime. I was very excited and was told you couldn‚Äôt go wrong. The friend was right for the most part, the food was incredible. We ordered a variety to cater for vegetarians and meat eaters alike. As much as we loved the food, the service (one particular employee in particular) reallyyyy tainted our experience. We arrived and immediately notified the host that although just two of us had arrived, we would eventually have 5 in 15 minutes and were happy to wait at the bar or a smaller table in the meantime. Although most of the staff was fairly friendly, the man we told this to could not have been more unfriendly and grumpy. He rolled his eyes, told us there was only so much he can do (to which we replied it would be understandable if we had to wait a beat when they arrived). Meanwhile, a couple that was sitting at a five person table graciously offered to swap tables with our two person one. He managed to enthusiastically butter them up and refuse to allow the switch. It was so uncomfortable that another waiter went as far as to say not to listen to his colleague as he was rude and not helpful. To top it off, he ended up being our waiter upstairs. Although he actually was quite helpful with food recommendations and portions, he continued to be rude by being snarky and correcting our attempt to be polite by speaking in Spanish. He ridiculed the fact that we accidentally said copa instead of vaso and mocked our mistake by bringing us a wine glass. I‚Äôm so torn about coming back. This was by far the rudest server we have encountered during our two weeks, but the food was indeed quite good. Be warned- the upstairs feels like an overflow/party room and the atmosphere pales in comparison to below. I‚Äôm not one to write reviews but cannot help but give a heads up.

title_review: One of the best tapas in Madrid
review_preview: I come very often to Madrid from Prague to piano training and pedagogy Suzuki training.  My husband is English and I am Puertorican. We both love good food. We found this gem after walking in the rain for hours. We had the boar roll (our...
review_full: I come very often to Madrid from Prague to piano training and pedagogy Suzuki training. My husband is English and I am Puertorican. We both love good food. We found this gem after walking in the rain for hours. We had the boar roll (our favorite), aubergines wrapped in bacon with tomato orange sauce, panko chicken strips, Manchego cheese cured with black truffles (absolutely delicious) with wine, beers and excellent service. I read review from an American saying that he had the aubergine with bacon and that it was delicious although it was not bacon. Well, certainly not streaky American bacon. If he travels and try all the world bacons, he would learn that American bacon is not the ‚Äúonly‚Äù bacon. Take for example the English bacon! Full of meat. Take the Eastern Europe bacon, extra thick and chunky, take the Italian pancetta. What I am trying to say is that North Americans aka USA people think their food products are the one and only ones in the world! So beware of reviews from some kind of people. The service here was absolutely out if the world. Many waiters looking after you! We travel a lot and know what is good food and good service. This place really deserves an excellent rate. Money worth food was excellent as well! We are definitely coming back!
